page.title: 07Housing in Chitterne
page.content: The majority of the housing stock in Chitterne (south) and area to the south and west is over 5O years old, with the exception of a small estate of seven 4-bedroomed detached houses built in 1975, and five other houses and bungalows. Most of the other houses are mainly cob and slate cottages, though practically every building material is represented in the area. Many of these were farm labourer's cottages but are now almost all privately owned. A row of farm cottages along the Shrewton road was demolished in 1963 to allow for road widening, and the residents rehoused mainly in Local Authority houses elsewhere in the village.
